sources.title: The Unholy Night (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. The Unholy Night is mostly remembered now for a small role played by Boris Karloff and for being directed by actor Lionel Barrymore. Still, it was moody and atmospheric enough that contemporary reviews were mostly positive. Version sourced from "PizzaFlix": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RCF_auveQzQ

sources.title: The Unholy Night (1929)
sources.description: The Unholy Night is a 1929 American pre-Code mystery film directed by Lionel Barrymore. It features a blend of mystery and horror elements, making it one of the early sound films in the horror genre. The story revolves around Lord Montague, who survives an assassination attempt in London. He discovers that members of his old army regiment are being murdered. To protect the remaining members, a Scotland Yard inspector gathers them at Montague's estate, leading to a series of mysterious events and deaths.¬†

metadata.Plot: On a dark foggy London night, someone tries to strangle Lord Montague, but he escapes. Only to discover the four other men who did get killed were old regimental comrades in Gallipoli. When Scotland Yard gets Monty to gather the other nine surviving officers at his home, one of them is murdered, and no one else has entered the house. Now, they must determine who the murderer is.
